abstract: JPMorgan Chase is moving its proprietary trading unit out of its investment bank and into its asset management unit in a bid to comply with new federal regulations.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase is moving its proprietary trading unit out of its investment bank and into its asset management unit in a bid to comply with new federal regulations.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase is moving its proprietary trading unit out of its investment bank and into its asset management unit in a bid to comply with new federal regulations that seek to restrict commercial banks from trading for their own account.

headline.main: JPMorgan Shifting Its Proprietary Trading Desk

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
